body_content.explanation: to invent a plan or an idea again or create something again, in a new or different way:
examples: The company has downsized, and it now has to re-conceive itself.
They have reconceived the house as an Italian palace.
The developed world will need to re-conceive the way they deliver products and services to the developing world.

body_content.explanation: to become pregnant for a second, third, etc. time:
examples: The study examines the effects of a postmiscarriage menstrual period prior to reconceiving.
For four years after the death of her unborn baby, she struggled to re-conceive.
